Tags: equality-commutativity python inclusion class

EqualityCommutativityInclusion (python class)

See also

math concept | python declaration class | python sample

This section presents the EqualityCommutativityInclusion python class.

This class models the inclusion of the equality-commutativity inference-rule in the target theory-elaboration-sequence.

Punctilious users do not need to instanciate objects from this class. In effect, the TheoryElaborationSequence class exposes the equality_commutativity property, and instanciation is automatic when this property is accessed for the first time.

class punctilious.EqualityCommutativityInclusion(t, echo=None, proof=None)
infer_formula(x_equal_y=None, echo=None)

Apply the equality-commutativity inference-rule and return the inferred-formula.
